greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of factorizations of n into factors > 1 using only primes and perfect powers.
comment: First differs from A000688 at a(36) = 5, A000688(36) = 4.
Terms in this sequence only depend on the prime signature of n. - _David A. Corneth_, Dec 26 2018
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..100000
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
program: (PARI) A322453(n, m=n) = if(1==n, 1, my(s=0); fordiv(n, d, if((d>1)&&(d<=m)&&(ispower(d)||isprime(d)), s += A322453(n/d, d))); (s)); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 26 2018
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Dec 09 2018
